commit_message:
Return an error response if the specified flavor does not exists. (v4)

'nova list --flavor <id>' command outputs empty list, if there is not
any instance or flavor. A user cannot know the reason of empty list easily.
This patch changes a response to error if the specified flavor-id does not
exist instead of empty list.

Example:
 $ nova flavor-list
 +----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+-------------+
 | ID | Name      | Memory_MB | Disk | Ephemeral | Swap | VCPUs | RXTX_Factor | Is_Public | extra_specs |
 +----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+-------------+
 | 1  | m1.tiny   | 512       | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | {}          |
 | 2  | m1.small  | 2048      | 20   | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | {}          |
 | 3  | m1.medium | 4096      | 40   | 0         |      | 2     | 1.0         | True      | {}          |
 | 4  | m1.large  | 8192      | 80   | 0         |      | 4     | 1.0         | True      | {}          |
 | 5  | m1.xlarge | 16384     | 160  | 0         |      | 8     | 1.0         | True      | {}          |
 +----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+-------------+

Before applying this patch:
 $ nova list --flavor 10

 $

After applying this patch:
 $ nova list --flavor 10
 ERROR: Flavor could not be found (HTTP 422) (Request-ID: req-003d4bbc-f338-4361-9eeb-1cf18073a5a8)
 $

Changelog of v4:
 * Change a response code of NotFoundFlavor from 404 to 422.

Changelog of v3:
 * Merge patchset2(change a response of test_get_all_by_flavor) into one patch.
 * Change a response code of NotFoundFlavor from 400 to 404.

Fixes bug 1076863
Change-Id: I45f35ae6a4bf1de734c258ef819fb9b4d7f9681e

commit_message:
Don't inherit from base.html in 500 error page

For server errors, the context passed to the template is empty,
so things like STATIC_URL and context processors don't work.

Fixes bug 1067206.

Change-Id: Ia1801afaecd6a23fbcc6054552d0fd313597d1c1

commit_message:
Make ec2_instance_create db method consistant across db apis

Fixes bug 1079463

Also changes call to ec2_instance_create in sqlalchemy instance_create
method to go through db api as opposed to direct to sqlalchemy api.

Change-Id: I60136a2c7019bda25225d8e02e82a9ccfbb61e2f

[{'created': '2012-11-20 20:23:48.000000000', 'message': 'Convert rxtx_factor to an int.

When creating a new instance type we validate that only integer
values are used for rxtx_factor:

[root@nova1 ~]# nova flavor-create --ephemeral 0 --swap 0
--rxtx-factor=1.0 foo 99 256 10 1
ERROR: rxtx_factor must be an integer.

In contrast rxtx_factor is stored and displayed as a float within Nova:

[root@nova1 ~]# nova flavor-show 1 | grep rxtx
| rxtx_factor | 1.0 |

For consistency this patch updates Nova so that we store and display
rxtx_factor as an integer.

Fixes LP Bug #1081287.

Change-Id: I1663d4192674c3ebad3fe0ab3f759b7ccefae2c7
'}]
commit_message:
Convert rxtx_factor to an int.

When creating a new instance type we validate that only integer
values are used for rxtx_factor:

[root@nova1 ~]# nova flavor-create --ephemeral 0 --swap 0
--rxtx-factor=1.0 foo 99 256 10 1
ERROR: rxtx_factor must be an integer.

In contrast rxtx_factor is stored and displayed as a float within Nova:

[root@nova1 ~]# nova flavor-show 1 | grep rxtx
| rxtx_factor | 1.0 |

For consistency this patch updates Nova so that we store and display
rxtx_factor as an integer.

Fixes LP Bug #1081287.

Change-Id: I1663d4192674c3ebad3fe0ab3f759b7ccefae2c7

commit_message:
Detect shared storage; handle base cleanup better.

If base image storage is shared, we need to care about remote
instances when we clean up. This patch "learns" which storage is
shared, and then decides what base images are in use anywhere
on the set of compute nodes which share that base storage.

This is complicated because shared instance storage doesn't have
to be per-cluster. It could for example be per rack. We need to
handle that properly.

This should resolve bug 1078594.

Change-Id: I36d0d6e965b114bb68c8f7b7fd43f8e96b2dd8f5

commit_message:
Fix non-primitive uses of instance in compute/manager

We can't rely on the fact that instances are db/sqlalchemy/models
objects. This properly addresses them as dicts.

Change-Id: I7c4c01fc617c6f7e1fd2dfa428efe0b4205557bc

commit_message:
Pin pep8 1.3.3

Apart of making pep8 version standard across all openstack
projects.

Also fix tools/hacking.py so it is compliant for pep8 1.2
and beyond, taken from fbc4568 in the nova tree.

Change-Id: I801c98a01960fa113dae1b6174c1a06bb149fea3
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix os-hosts extension can't return xml response correctly.

Also add os-hosts integrated testing template files.
fix bug 1075575
fix bug 1070167.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I6b9f9e58e7cbe10a931d2c83d9baf9dcee74de08

commit_message:
Reworks quotas and services panels into System Info panel.

This is a step towards combining all the "read only" data about
an OpenStack cloud into one place for admin inspection.

Implements blueprint system-info-panel.

Change-Id: I2dc52a855c1c8a488fb9c66b82e0faca765b3812

commit_message:
Unifies Horizon conf.

Centralizes all of Horizon's configuration options so that
they're all uniformly accesible from a single place and always
guaranteed to exist.

Implements blueprint unify-config.

Change-Id: I3279b7ccd58302fcff4f0d273f89f282a285c442

commit_message:
updating sphinx documentation

* adding openstack theming (copied from keystone project theme)
* updating .gitignore to ignore generated API docs
* updated formatting in index.rst page
* updaed openstack/common/processutils.py to match hacking docstring
* updated docstrings to resolve sphinx warnings

Change-Id: Ie89afe20eeab1efd2daf440fc65ccdf90f723c51

commit_message:
Honour LOGIN_URL when redirecting to login page

Currently the redirect is always made to the url of the 'login' view.
This change makes redirects go to LOGIN_URL, so the default login view
can be replaced with a view at another url/name.

Fixes bug 1079444.

Change-Id: Ib56200679668dd053d3c6ac24807d2a2affc0df8

commit_message:
Send block device mappings to rebuild_instance.

Send the block device mappings for an instance to the rebuild_instance
method in the compute manager.  This moves a db read from nova-compute
up to the api service.

Part of blueprint no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I15967652cfa539fab3b55c224e8ebbc12363004a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-15 03:58:38.000000000', 'message': 'Allow running tests individually

If there is a non-zero number of arguments, run_tests.sh now
passes through the arguments to `manage.py test`, skipping the
default horizon/openstack_dashboard suites.

The correct settings module is chosen based on the first module
given in the argument. E.g., horizon.test.tests.tables chooses
the horizon.test.settings module.

Change-Id: I5321e87bec6831fb7574e045a82de06086b1d0d0
'}]
commit_message:
Allow running tests individually

If there is a non-zero number of arguments, run_tests.sh now
passes through the arguments to `manage.py test`, skipping the
default horizon/openstack_dashboard suites.

The correct settings module is chosen based on the first module
given in the argument. E.g., horizon.test.tests.tables chooses
the horizon.test.settings module.

Change-Id: I5321e87bec6831fb7574e045a82de06086b1d0d0

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-15 23:51:31.000000000', 'message': "use addHorizonLoadEvent() method instead of $(document).ready()

These pages load all the scripts at the end, which means jQuery
isn't loaded yet, which means there is no $ variable, which means
the page throws errors when attempting to resize the iframe.  Oops.

There's a special method defined for doing what is being tried here,
called addHorizonLoadEvent(), so use it instead.  Confirmed working
correctly in DevStack.

Fixes Bug 1050316

Change-Id: Ia6a90485acc2454ff0320abcd51860423282a659
"}]
commit_message:
use addHorizonLoadEvent() method instead of $(document).ready()

These pages load all the scripts at the end, which means jQuery
isn't loaded yet, which means there is no $ variable, which means
the page throws errors when attempting to resize the iframe.  Oops.

There's a special method defined for doing what is being tried here,
called addHorizonLoadEvent(), so use it instead.  Confirmed working
correctly in DevStack.

Fixes Bug 1050316

Change-Id: Ia6a90485acc2454ff0320abcd51860423282a659

commit_message:
Expose auth failure details in debug mode

Users can now run keystone with debug = True to reveal detailed messages
about authentication/authorization failures. This is especially useful
for new users setting up OpenStack for the first time.

Example: http://paste.openstack.org/raw/26228/

DocImpact

Change-Id: I0d072d1f0147b53da90cd4214a1e843bf39ee8e4

[{'created': '2012-11-20 16:47:12.000000000', 'message': "make QuantumV2 support requested nic ordering

fixes bug 1064524

The QuantumV2 did not honor nic ordering, so nics were attached in
Quantum's db natural order.  This patch sorts the networks honor requested nic
ordering when Nova calls the V2Quantum API.  Unit tests have been updated to
confirm ordering is honored.

Change-Id: I44a6a4736c78e86e83b6e682e63f93a5b47652da
"}]
commit_message:
make QuantumV2 support requested nic ordering

fixes bug 1064524

The QuantumV2 did not honor nic ordering, so nics were attached in
Quantum's db natural order.  This patch sorts the networks honor requested nic
ordering when Nova calls the V2Quantum API.  Unit tests have been updated to
confirm ordering is honored.

Change-Id: I44a6a4736c78e86e83b6e682e63f93a5b47652da

commit_message:
refactor: extract method: connect_volume

Related to blueprint xenapi-volume-drivers

Extract connect_volume call from attach_volume, and a test for
attach_volume. By extracting this call, it will be easier to implement
other drivers, by providing an alternate implementation for this
extracted method.

Change-Id: Ie5a17ec7fada26a9df5ba8a29ed0dadeb02516e8

commit_message:
Improved quota output

This patch makes the output of quota show a bit more informative
by not setting a simple None to a non-existing quota, but not showing it
all together.

Kind of fixes bug #1078906
and also bug #1078089

Change-Id: Ic42837d218a80f37e0c6d56625c9804d076f444c

commit_message:
Re-add postgresql-setup initdb for Fedora

The Fedora RPM does not set up the postgresql data directory.
postgresql-setup initdb must be run after installing the RPM.

Change-Id: I5e5ab659e83f4ee6a024f74a23bf4562ea0065ce

As per the db migration issues from in Folsom, can you add a test in nova.tests.test_migrations (test_migration_141) to test this specific migration with some data in the db"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-11-20 14:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Johannes: Good point. I'll update that shortly.

-----

Joe: I'm not convinced this migration warrants a "Folsom style" migration test. It seems like most of those tests were performing data conversions (one column to another) where this is simply changing the length of an existing table column.

I also feel like we would be better served by a more generic upgrade testing mechanism rather than putting these into Nova. It seems like a higher level of testing... Just my take. That said I'm okay have tests for really complex migrations in Nova too... but I'm not sure this one qualifies...'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-11-20 15:02:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-11-20 15:21:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Convert migrations.instance_uuid to String(36).

Updates the length of the instance_uuid column in the migrations
to match the length of UUID's in Nova.

Fixes LP Bug #1080854.

Change-Id: I213c48835f9efa4a9a84932c343c1079c5cc65ca

commit_message:
install nodejs-legacy on quantal

quantal changed the name of the node binary on disk, which breaks
horizon on 12.10 installs. Provide a work around for installing
the legacy package on that environment.

Fixes bug #1070083

Change-Id: If8ef211d12451ef4e1df0d2398cf18a3b2c46da3

commit_message:
Add volume usage information to the management api detailed view.

* Split out the guest information code into a separate function.
* Update the management detailed instance to include volume_used.
* Return the volume used information in the detailed instance
  management api view.

Change-Id: I28999a90af5c725a60e62b564ccb6cc8a6b6fd05
Implements: blueprint volume-usage

  raise Unauthorized('User name not recognized')

commit_message:
Expose authn/z failure info to API in debug mode

This allows us to raise exceptions with very specific messages:

  raise Unauthorized('User name not recognized')

In debug mode, this feedback would be exposed to the API user; without
debug mode, these details are suppressed.

Change-Id: I05c5dce3b1e2ba1123450b302e10b8ba3c265557

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-11-20 19:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

We're not using this repo yet to vet new dependencies

The topic was discussed at the grizzly summit:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/process-dependency-management

I suggest you just start a thread on the openstack-dev mailing list - i.e. "what do people think of the idea of using psutil?"

Thanks'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2012-11-20 19:36:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Per Mark, I'll email the list."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-14 02:26:05.000000000', 'message': 'Add psutil 0.6.0 or newer

There are several places throughout the Nova code where psutil
can replace non-portable code, such as that which parses /proc.

Change-Id: Iaef7b9773a452395006573574dbe42ce16379541
'}]
commit_message:
Add psutil 0.6.0 or newer

There are several places throughout the Nova code where psutil
can replace non-portable code, such as that which parses /proc.

Change-Id: Iaef7b9773a452395006573574dbe42ce16379541

commit_message:
Make it possible to choose a different VIF driver.

This is useful when working with baremetal which uses openvswitch quantum
plugin, but baremetal-vif vif driver.

bug 1080562

Change-Id: I9f94a8f2d7f11fa0771a5304b0aed1d0de5a3db7

[{'created': '2012-11-15 15:37:54.000000000', 'message': 'Properly list tokens with a null tenant

We store the tenant as a null value in json, so checking to see
if it exists is not sufficient. This makes the check safer, checking
for existance and not null before continuing.

Fixes bug 1078497

Change-Id: Ida1b958e5df6f93a30efae0d3f71df668751ff81
'}]
commit_message:
Properly list tokens with a null tenant

We store the tenant as a null value in json, so checking to see
if it exists is not sufficient. This makes the check safer, checking
for existance and not null before continuing.

Fixes bug 1078497

Change-Id: Ida1b958e5df6f93a30efae0d3f71df668751ff81

commit_message:
Return 403 when admin deletes a deleted image

1. Returned a 403 Forbidden error when an admin user tries to delete a deleted
image.
2. Added unit test coverage.

Fixes LP: #1060944

Change-Id: I1a5c4ca18e2e70d8a614b3132bfcea1f56c5f59c

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-26 01:02:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Love the code. Just -1 for discussion on two things:

a) should the default be something different? I think project makes the most sense

b) do we have some means for dealing with pre-existing duplicates if someone wants to turn this on?"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-10-26 04:05:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't see the need for 'global' as an option.  One would get an error for duplicate name... but would get seriously confused when they don't see a duplicate name within their list of instances.

I also don't like the implementation because it's race-y... and it's potentially a big performance penalty.  We need to be removing race conditions, not adding more. :)

Vish:  Prefer we leave the old behavior the default here.  We should limit changes to default behavior without some sort of warning that the default will be changing in the future."}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-10-26 15:06:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

ok...

Vish:

a)  I'm inclined to think that the default should be to stick with the current behavior even though I can't think of a great use-case for having duplicate server names in a project.  *shrug*

b)  At the moment, turning this on would leave pre-existing duplicates as they are, since the test only happens at creation time.  We could add a separate code path that purges duplicates but that seems like a real can o' worms, and we certainly wouldn't want to do it non-interactively.

Chris:

I want the 'global' option because it's needed for a particular use case at WMF (having to do with our DNS setup.)  I will tweak the error message to make it clearer what's happening.

Regarding races:  I see what you mean :(  I'm thinking that if I move the test until after the reservation is made it will eliminate the race -- does that seem right to you?  Or do you have other thoughts about how to make this less racy?  I'm not as concerned about the performance hit since 1) it's an optional setting and 2) 'global' mode only makes sense in a small-sized private cloud anyway."}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-10-30 23:01:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1998, 'date': '2012-10-30 23:06:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-30 23:35:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

commit_message:
Add nova option osapi_compute_unique_server_name_scope

Setting this option forces nova-api to check for duplicate
server names either in the project or system-wide.

The default behavior remains the same: duplicate names are allowed.

DocImpact: Adds a new Nova config option

Change-Id: I28baf8c63f9c62f457bfff0a2fb510f0c517a351

commit_message:
Pin pep8 to 1.3.3

Apart of making pep8 version standard across all openstack
projects.

With this change we ignore E712 since it is normal to use
"column == True" in sqlalchemy.

Change-Id: I73a162847a79558cb158112878033edf18039805
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Adds note about possible mismatch between keystoneclient params

related to --token and --endpoint params
used with keystone client commands.

Rebase against master to pick up that note.

Adds link to pip install instructions in the CLI guide to the note.

Change-Id: Iee15faa11c92a0ad216e71bd7510b8d4659fe885

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 447, 'name': 'dan wendlandt', 'email': 'dan@nicira.com', 'username': 'danwent'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1689, 'name': 'Robert Kukura', 'email': 'rk@theep.net', 'username': 'rkukura'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2649, 'name': 'Zhang Hua', 'email': 'zhuadl@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'zhang-hare'}, {'_account_id': 4395, 'name': 'Aaron Rosen', 'email': 'aaronorosen@gmail.com', 'username': 'arosen'}, {'_account_id': 5754, 'name': 'Alex Xu', 'email': 'hejie.xu@intel.com', 'username': 'xuhj'}]

'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

functionality looks fine, just some concerns over code duplication, and nits around error messages.  Based on our discussion at the summit, I'd like to see plugins use shared libraries when they do identical things.  Ultimately, OVS + LB plugins will either share a bunch of code, or get to the point where they can be one plugin (its unclear to me at this point which will happen)"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

great.  maybe create a new utils file like l2-plugin utils to place all functionality that you think may be common across l2-plugin that implement similar abstractions (and in the future, potentially be used by an l2-modular plugin).'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

parse_interface_mapping() converts a list of key-value items (<key>:<value>) into a dict, so it can be more generalized method (like convert_kvlist_to_dict or something. It is more suitable if the method is moved to common/.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

When I commented I did not take care of error messages so much. I understood the situation. On the other hand, I feel the method parsing bridge parameters is a bit non-generic for common/*. Is there any place for such agent-common functions?

I think moving a common function is not necessarily required in this patch. Perhaps this patch is the first step of your work described in the summit.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi,
I think that Alex has a very good point. Please consider making the code common if possible.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

OK, I'll update the patch to use a quantum.common.utils.parse_mappings function."}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (4 inline comments)

Updated patch set coming soon. I used the existing utils module for now, since there is really nothing l2-specific about parsing this sort of mapping.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Moving the parsing to a common module could be a bit of a slippery slope. 

I agree a generic function handling the bridge and interface mappings for the agents is possible. But if we want the error messages to remain useful, we need to pass in the names of the items being mapped from (i.e. "physical network") and to (i.e.. "bridge" or "interface") as strings.

But both plugins also have similar parsing code for vlan ranges and openvswitch's parsing for tunnel ranges is in the same category. Should these also go in the same common module as part of this patch?

Is the effort to make generic versions of these simple functions worthwhile? Parameterizing them with strings for the error messages makes them more complex than they would be if not generic.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/16044/2/check/gate-quantum-python27/2303 : SUCCESS

Code looks good. One minor comment.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Hi,
My thinking is if we are touching code then we might as well localize it.
I would prefer that we do try and remove the \ if possible.
It is just a pain to see.
If others are ok with this then it can go through
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (4 inline comments)

Hopefully final patch set coming right up!'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'message': "Improve openvswitch and linuxbridge agents' parsing of mappings

Detect duplicate bridge or physical network in openvswitch agent
bridge mappings. Fixes bug 1067669.

Also refactor linuxbridge agent parsing of interace mappings to be
similar to current openvswitch agent code, and add unit tests for
interface mappings.

Change-Id: I342eaeeb6ff4c6e25d57d631f250faac082011b8
"}, {'created': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'message': "Improve openvswitch and linuxbridge agents' parsing of mappings

Created generic quantum.utils.parse_mappings function that detects
duplicate key or value strings, and changed openvswitch and
linuxbridge agents to use this to parse their mappings from physical
networks to bridges or interfaces. Fixes bug 1067669.

Also fixed some typos in comments.

Change-Id: I342eaeeb6ff4c6e25d57d631f250faac082011b8
"}, {'created': '2012-11-20 16:05:41.000000000', 'message': "Improve openvswitch and linuxbridge agents' parsing of mappings

Created generic quantum.utils.parse_mappings function that detects
duplicate key or value strings, and changed openvswitch and
linuxbridge agents to use this to parse their mappings from physical
networks to bridges or interfaces. Fixes bug 1067669.

commit_message:
Improve openvswitch and linuxbridge agents' parsing of mappings

Created generic quantum.utils.parse_mappings function that detects
duplicate key or value strings, and changed openvswitch and
linuxbridge agents to use this to parse their mappings from physical
networks to bridges or interfaces. Fixes bug 1067669.

Also fixed some typos in comments.

Change-Id: I342eaeeb6ff4c6e25d57d631f250faac082011b8

Hi,

I think the original 'select a specific host to boot instances on' direction of this section is more useful to operators to test particular hosts. eg look at what the original bug report was trying to do :)

I also think that this isn't the right section to introduce the concept of an 'availability zone'.

Suggest: somewhere else in the doc - introduce the concept of the availability zone, link it to this section, and focus on the single host case.

If you disagree, then the suggestion I have is to update the XML-id so it matches the new title :)"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-11-15 02:19:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Might be useful to add this additional information from Jordan Callicoat: 
Yeah, the availability zone syntax seems to be the right way to do it. Works in Essex also, though Essex python-novaclient doesn't support the --availability_zone flag; you have to do it manually, like:

curl -XPOST -H x-auth-token:xxxxx -H content-type:application/json -d '{"server": {"name": "test-az-force-host", "imageRef": "c4ead89e-b9e5-4a6d-81b6-f9eafe6dde36", "flavorRef": "1", "availability_zone": "nova:server2"}}' http://192.168.122.5:8774/v2/70807f9ce762441fbece40a8f282761f/servers

commit_message:
Fix bug 1061665, --force_hosts hint for launching instance updates

--force_hosts no longer available in Folsom, have to indicate
an availability zone instead.

Patchset attempts to explain how to get the availability zone
name that you want. Please review.

Patchset addresses comments about zone versus host, adding
new section rather than replacing host section completely.

Change-Id: Ifea0df3dc950c165718fa160bc08f1b1487c3f82

The reason we have not "undone" this on master yet is it is not clear if and when the fixes done by pbrady will land in the distros. So I'm not sure about this at all.
Not adding preemption points to os seems like a really big hammer.

It seems like the best approach is to just apply the one line fix to eventlet. This is now done in Fedora / EPEL for example. It would be good to add "ubuntu" to the bug above,
so that they might include the evenlet patch too, as it's easier anyway to patch eventlet than various openstack stable packages.

Also this particular issue doesn't seem to be an issue on trunk testing so a workaround there doesn't seem necessary on trunk, as devs using Fedora (and preumably promptly updated ubuntu) would be covered.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-11-20 15:59:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

gongysh:

I thought about hacking extensions.py so it wouldn't load itself... but that seemed a bit dirty. I realize this change is larger but the extensions framework should be considered part of the core Quantum API IMO... and as such doesn't really seem to belong in the directory where we store individual extensions.

As for breaking external extensions I think that is just how it goes. I'm not trying to cause instability... but AFAIK this is an internal class and we reserve the right to restructure it from time to time.

The fact that we are moving it should probably go into the release notes however so that will hopefully give anyone upgrading a fair warning of the change."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-11-20 15:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-11-20 15:59:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Good catch on the cisco extension changes. Patchset 4 fixes them... what concerns me however is that none of the upstream tests are actually running any of those tests (otherwise the changed imports should have been caught in patchset 3).

Ideally running tox or run_tests.sh would (by default) run unit tests on all the vendor extensions. It appears that most vendors have put tests into the top level 'tests' directory however most of the Cisco tests are actually inside the plugin directory (and as such don't get picked up by tox, etc). Is there a good reason we shouldn't move the Cisco tests into the top level 'tests' directory to head off future regressions?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-20 15:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Move extension.py into quantum/api.

This change moves extensions.py out of the extensions module
and into the api module. This resolves an issue where the
following log WARNING message would occur each time the Quantum
API starts:

Did not find expected name "Extensions" in
/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/quantum/extensions/extensions.py

Fixes LP Bug #1074895.

Change-Id: Ia5ed206870551f9b33b74dcdc9d0503e447f298d

Stable oslo (aka common) update

Updated all of the stable code. This addresses critical issues with qpid
messaging, support for windows, etc.

Change-Id: I60c54b608efef472b893d7296ab9c0caa538ca49

commit_message:
Add an image repo to encapsulate db api access

This patch adds glance.db.ImageRepo which provides a Repository-like
abstraction over image persistence. In the process of testing, a few
additional changes to the simple and sqlalchemy db apis were needed.

Partially implements bp:glance-domain-logic-layer

Change-Id: Ie35e427aa8fc7f3bece8d4d383afde4cc02b2096

commit_message:
Refactor where store drivers are initialized

The call to create_stores was happening in the v1 and v2 API
controllers. This moves that call and the verification that
the default_store exists into the necessary binaries.

Fixes bug 1039727.

Change-Id: I36542fd9b1d536d6266898766317abe110bb71a2

[{'created': '2012-11-20 11:41:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes a bug in get_info in the Hyper-V Driver

Fixes Bug #1081070

When a VM is getting manually shut down on Hyper-V or in case of a host
reboot, "nova list" still reports the VM as ACTIVE after
nova.compute.manager_sync_power_states runs.

The bug is releated to the vm state being incorrectly returned as a
string.

Change-Id: I87957d2fa504bad110fb4d1d8b209a45cad11c2c
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes a bug in get_info in the Hyper-V Driver

Fixes Bug #1081070

When a VM is getting manually shut down on Hyper-V or in case of a host
reboot, "nova list" still reports the VM as ACTIVE after
nova.compute.manager_sync_power_states runs.

The bug is releated to the vm state being incorrectly returned as a
string.

Change-Id: I87957d2fa504bad110fb4d1d8b209a45cad11c2c

commit_message:
Proxy floating IP calls to quantum

Fixes bug 1023169. Also fixes bug 1031119.

In Folsom, floating IP support is moved to Quantum. By this commit floating IP
calls to nova are proxied to Quantum and nova command can be used to manage
floating IPs.

pip-requires is also updated and now requires python-quantumclient >=2.1 which
supports floating IP feature in Quantum.

Change-Id: I2c32948a8fe291601216dc62d546da64a8fb8428
(cherry picked from commit 7948b7a572e33e3fd541e27f2617d832eb43b504)

if checksumming was disabled, if there was already a cached checksum
for the image. This resolves bug 1075017.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I38f5914cd9d6326fdf5e5d7f0f57885ff8b5ff32
(cherry picked from commit 1442177d5d1c388d75e7d7f0316e2c2891f5b779)

commit_message:
Don't verify image hashes if checksumming is disabled.

There was a bug where we were checking base image checksums, even
if checksumming was disabled, if there was already a cached checksum
for the image. This resolves bug 1075017.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I38f5914cd9d6326fdf5e5d7f0f57885ff8b5ff32
(cherry picked from commit 1442177d5d1c388d75e7d7f0316e2c2891f5b779)

Change-Id: I5db2b575d24f6b1b358489e309af7e6ace2950fd

commit_message:
Fix Broken XML Namespace Handling

nodeName is set to ns2:metadata and not just metadata when namespaces are
specified using first example in the defect. Explicitly check namespaces
where necessary and use localName instead of nodeName.
Ensure that scheduler_hints are picked up from the correct namespace

fix lines too long from pep8

Fixes bug 887191

Change-Id: I5db2b575d24f6b1b358489e309af7e6ace2950fd
(cherry picked from commit 10caf4b48fa67b160e6024a801efbda292d44ebf)

commit_message:
Updates clear_db() to unregister models and close session.

fixes bug 1080988

This change fixes the bug by ensuring the metadata and session objects
are properly cleaned up by clear_db(). Using the proper calls reduces
the memory required by unit tests.

Change-Id: I1d1802b642eff83b7f96211608195afaf68e855a

These tests need some work (as mentioned in the inline comments).

Also, it should be mentioned in comments at least that the account and container tests are somewhat fragile since swift is eventually consistent. IOW, you can create and object but not see it in a container listing immediately. Likewise, the account metadata won't be updated immediately on an object PUT. It's likely that in a testing environment that there won't be any issues that would expose an eventual consistency window, but this should at least be acknowledged as a limitation of black-box testing."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-11-08 19:24:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-11-08 19:40:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

John, I am confused about why you say not to check for 204. The spec at http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-object-storage/1.0/content/delete-account-metadata.html says it returns 204. All of the tempest tests check for the documented return codes. Why is this wrong? One important goal of tempest is to make sure documented APIs don't change in incompatible ways."}, {'account_id': 5676, 'date': '2012-11-11 16:34:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (5 inline comments)

commit_message:
Added Swift tests:
      * account: delete account metadata
      * container: retrieve/delete container metadata
      * object: retrieve/copy(2 ways) object
Syntax bug fix in container_client.py:
      return resp. body => return resp, body
Fixed passing headers parameter in head method in rest_client.py:
      return self.request('HEAD', url, headers)
Removed unused imports.

Change-Id: Ica67d6ecae80f851e9e05ebeb4c7d461eba143ee

"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-11-14 09:29:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(7 inline comments)

A good start! See my inline comments.

It would be great also to split each counter type in its own class, like it's currently done in virt pollster."}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-11-14 09:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (4 inline comments)

Thanks for review.

Sure, I will split it into multiple pollster.

The only concern to split the counter is, that will create multiple rpc call for the rpcapi.get_diagnostics(). Although the computer agent is on the same node as nova computer, the rpc_call still need go-through the rabbit per my understanding, and not sure the impact to the performance/scalability.

Possibly I can use some cache mechanism to achieve it. Will consider it later after this patch. If we can maintain cache, we can also reduce request to nova-api through nova-client, which is also benifit.

Thanks
--jyh'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-11-14 09:54:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yeah, I wouldn't worry too much about caching for now.

I'm not even sure in the end that we'll end up caching; we may end up merging counter emissions based on the same RPC requests in some other way."}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-11-14 10:18:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So how do you think if we need a new rpcapi call to get the metadata as I discussed in the email? Or we can discuss it in tomorrow's metering meeting."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-11-14 10:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think I missed or forgot about that, where was that mail?'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-11-14 10:25:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The content of the email pasted below.

Thanks for Doug's patch for libvirt, which remind me that I don't need pass the real nova instance object, so I faked one. Considering we only depends on one interface from rpcapi, I think it's feasible for us to make sure this faked object is not broken. 

So the issue left is the metadata. Followed is the information we can got from get_diagnostics. Although it provide all the static information that's presented by current libvirt pollster, it does not include any information for the virtual block/nic devices ,like MAC, IP, filter, DHCPSERVER, while is provided by current libvirt pollster. Also I didn't find method to get such information, other than call nova libvirt driver directly.

So my question is, should we create another rpcapi for this monitor specific purpose? I'd prefer to yes, since that will make life easier.

+------------------+------------+
| Property         | Value      |
+------------------+------------+
| cpu0_time        | 7580000000 |
| memory           | 524288     |
| vda_errors       | -1         |
| vda_read         | 262144     |
| vda_read_req     | 112        |
| vda_write        | 5606400    |
| vda_write_req    | 367        |
| vnet0_rx         | 1959353    |
| vnet0_rx_drop    | 0          |
| vnet0_rx_errors  | 0          |
| vnet0_rx_packets | 17673      |
| vnet0_tx         | 58983      |
| vnet0_tx_drop    | 0          |

commit_message:
Use nova-compute RPC for nova pollster

Try to use nova-compute RPC for compute pollster. This avoid different virt
driver support in ceilometer side. But need an extra RPC call, which
may have some scalability issues.

Two concerns as commented in the patch:
1) currently RPCAPI requires an instance object, which can't be got from
   nova compute node, we fake a one as required by rpcapi.get_diagnostics
2) There is no metadata for block/nic device for instance, althoug diagnostics
   do provide all the static data needed by the pollster.

This patch does not implement disk pollster, since it's very similar to nic and
can be added easily.

This patch is purely for discussion purpose, not target for merge!

    For blueprint nova-pollster-compute-rpc

Change-Id: Ib2ecfe383f8158f941bcf276dbe231f4e42523de
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

[{'created': '2012-11-20 12:15:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix link to Fedora Planet site

The http://fedora.linux.duke.edu/fedorapeople/ link has not been
the official location for many years now. The Fedora Planet site
lives at http://planet.fedoraproject.org/ The official title is
also 'Planet Fedora' rather than 'Fedora People' (which refers
to the Fedora contributors personal webspace)

Change-Id: I6aeed67cfe228fec46256b4918e80fbfabcc5cfb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix link to Fedora Planet site

The http://fedora.linux.duke.edu/fedorapeople/ link has not been
the official location for many years now. The Fedora Planet site
lives at http://planet.fedoraproject.org/ The official title is
also 'Planet Fedora' rather than 'Fedora People' (which refers
to the Fedora contributors personal webspace)

Change-Id: I6aeed67cfe228fec46256b4918e80fbfabcc5cfb

I don't think *we* need unit test, I stole the script from nova & cinder. So if we have to add some unit tests, this scripts should first be moved into oslo.

However I'd really appreciate any hint on how to create this file at build time rather than embedding it in the repo. I've done this to mimick other projects, but I don't like it.
But I was not under the impression that setuptools would allow to do this neither. Maybe Doug has an idea."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-11-19 15:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

To create the sample file during the build we would need to modify the command class used by setuptools in setup.py. That change should probably go in openstack.common.setup, since there is already a similar step there for building the AUTHORS file.

When this is approved we will need similar changes in devstack to copy the default file into the right place before trying to modify it (unless that happens automatically?).'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2012-11-19 23:26:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Eugene,

I am fine with most of your answers.
On the situation were you could end have having multiple APIs for the same class of service differentiated by a URI prefix, my concern is that this will allow to have (in theory) multiple LB APIs at the same time.

I hope we all agree that Quantum should expose a single LB API that the 'official' LBaaS plugin, and any other plugin which will come in the future must implement."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-11-20 10:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (6 inline comments)

Concerning Yong's comment, Eugene is right that that controllers can be anything in the extension middleware and are not supposed to be plugins.
I fell for the same thing while reviewing the code.

the only improvement I can see over this is that actually the extension middleware should be totally oblivious of plugins. Indeed it seems we only need this info for computing the URI prefix. If that is the case I would consider whether the extension resources themselves could pass a URI prefix to the extension middleware. This is only optional advice.

I do not have any concern which has not been already discussed with Eugene. So I am ok to approve, but I still need to check test coverage (I'd go for the minor nits too, but it seems Gary and Yong already carefully went through them)."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-20 10:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-11-20 10:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Hi Eugene,

After the last comment concerning path prefix, which I missed, I decided to do testing adding an actual API extension for the dummy plugin. I found everything to be working fine, unless you create a wsgi resource with base.create_resource as the resource controller. If the controller just extends wsgi.controller then everything works fine.

Indeed in that case the resource you will create is a wsgi-fied request processing function, where the actual controller providing get_plugin_type in its stack (and not directly accessible).

In that case, the resource is created, but not mapped to an appropriate prefix.
For instance I can access dummy service with GET /v2.0/dummys instead of GET /v2.0/dummy_svc/dummys; as the plugin is correctly mapped this might bear the question about whether the prefix is actually needed or not.

I am however totally sure you already thought both about the necessity of the URI prefix and the use of base.create_resource, so I just want to hear your opinion.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-20 10:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: (3 inline comments)

Some really minor nits and then it has my +2'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2012-11-20 10:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2012-11-20 10:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2012-11-20 10:40:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Salvatore, regarding your comment:

Actually you made a good point. Beside the fact that isn't not necessary to use base.create_resource when making an extension, its usage simplifies some operations. 
I had to reconsider the way extension middleware gets a path prefix and decided to put this responsibility to an extension rather than to a framework by passing it directly to ResourceExtension contructor"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-20 10:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Works for me

commit_message:
The change allows loading several service plugins along with core plugin.

The following functionality changes were made:
1. Multiple plugins are loaded one per type
2. QuantumManager now holds dictionary {plugin_type: plugin_instance}
   Core plugin is stored there as well
3. Extensions are checked against all loaded plugins
4. Service plugins are specified by service_plugins option in quantum.conf file
5. Provide basic interface for service plugins
6. Introduce dummy service plugin as example and PoC
7. Service plugin's REST calls get corresponding plugin's common prefix
8. Add UTs for new extension framework functionality and for QuantumManager

Implements: blueprint quantum-service-framework
Change-Id: I1d00d6f848937410bccd91c852ff0871a86d7bb8

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-08 22:34:08.000000000', 'message': "show help when calling without arguments

When calling cinder without arguments you'll receive the following
output:

error: too few arguments
Try 'cinder help ' for more information.

With this change the help is also shown when calling cinder
without arguments. I think that's the expected behavior.

Change-Id: I8f46f67b7fef472ac344bb74f80cf1b77c4c4745
"}]
commit_message:
show help when calling without arguments

When calling cinder without arguments you'll receive the following
output:

error: too few arguments
Try 'cinder help ' for more information.

With this change the help is also shown when calling cinder
without arguments. I think that's the expected behavior.

Change-Id: I8f46f67b7fef472ac344bb74f80cf1b77c4c4745

[{'created': '2012-11-12 16:01:06.000000000', 'message': 'Enable Resize Tests and Fix Permission

Currently, the compute resize tests inside the
server actions tests are performed inside the
user context. This is wrong, as resize requires
an admin context.

* Fixes bug 1077992

Change-Id: I74066f02ec20aea130cf10e1c36d2000828b9d85
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Resize Tests and Fix Permission

Currently, the compute resize tests inside the
server actions tests are performed inside the
user context. This is wrong, as resize requires
an admin context.

* Fixes bug 1077992

Change-Id: I74066f02ec20aea130cf10e1c36d2000828b9d85

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'message': "[POC]Add request hook for quantum plugin

This patch resolve the plugin want to support some custom params of
request. Example, for support pagination, it need add new params
'limit' and 'marker'. But current version plugin api didn't support
adding new params. If adding new params to plugin api, it will break
out-of-source tree plugins.

We will continue discuss this on maillist.

Change-Id: I8744b4438b33c43faf0bdeeca5368df58e15f575
"}]
commit_message:
[POC]Add request hook for quantum plugin

This patch resolve the plugin want to support some custom params of
request. Example, for support pagination, it need add new params
'limit' and 'marker'. But current version plugin api didn't support
adding new params. If adding new params to plugin api, it will break
out-of-source tree plugins.

We will continue discuss this on maillist.

Change-Id: I8744b4438b33c43faf0bdeeca5368df58e15f575

Build failed

- http://logs.openstack.org/15815/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/18058 : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-11-10 20:14:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm guessing you forgot to commit some new files you created.

Also, please note that if this doesn't allow using syslog in much the way it currently works, I don't see folks approving this. Too many installations use centralized syslog servers already."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-11-12 19:52:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

This breaks logging for those of us using syslog for more than just writing to a local file. I know of clusters using syslog to aim logs at a centralized log host, and they'd never be okay with this change."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-11-12 19:57:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

In addition to the other reviews' valid points...

Assuming that "CPU 100% issue" is the problem which happens when logging to a unix domain socket while the syslog server is restarted, one existing workaround is to just use UDP to the node's local syslog daemon.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-20 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-20 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

subject: Put cooperative threading into authentication
messages:
[{'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-11-04 17:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-11-05 15:26:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

We are trying to move the other way:  we want to be able to run Keystone inside of Apache HTTPD without any eventlet code at all.  In order for a change like this to be acceptable, it needs to be done is such a way that it can be completely disabled when deploying in a non-eventlet based web container.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-20 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

commit_message:
Put cooperative threading into authentication

Use eventlet greenthreads to speed up authentication,
by using cooperative switching while plugins are blocking.

Change-Id: Id1af69c2648b7c74a0da2694b5cfa71463b636f4

directive, and adds links for the www/ html files.

Rebase against master, clean up install html page a bit.

commit_message:
Document glance-replicator

Documents the glance-replicator tool, which was added in Folsom.

Fixes bug 1068378

These docs are based on Michael Still's blog post:
http://www.stillhq.com/openstack/000007.html

Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/16377

One difference: Added a note about how to retrieve this tool
from github, since the original bug report implies that it does
not currently get distributed with glance.

Change-Id: I392b52924ad28dbba7c3c25a975db43762823bde

commit_message:
Tool to download all Amazon example templates

Templates are saved in templates/cloudformation-examples which is ignored
by git.

Its probably time we're exposed to a bit more template diversity.

Change-Id: I667c4f08fced353201ab9234a51526bcbeb0761b

commit_message:
Move db lookup for block device mappings.

This patch moves the db blookup for block device mappings for an
instance out of the _setup_block_device_mapping() function in the
compute manager.  The db lookups are now done much closer to the rpc
entry-points to the compute manager.

There are two rpc methods that eventually call down into this function:
run_instance and rebuild_instance.  This bit of refactoring will make it
a bit easier to update these methods to take in the block device
mappings over rpc.

Part of blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Id7d061e10ddc9e0d081e0ee97331631796b47729

commit_message:
Pass in correct volume_ref to create_from_snapshot.

The new rpc versioning change introduced a bug in the
create_from_snapshot code.  The originating volume_ref
was being passed in instead of the newly created volume_ref
as expected.

Fixes bug 1080898

Change-Id: I6ba4f4989c77e29685abb2649af8e003c447ab0f

commit_message:
Use CONF.import_opt() for nova.config opts

The only reason for importing nova.config now is where one of the
options defined in that file is needed. Rather than importing
nova.config using an import statement, use CONF.import_opt() so
that it is clear which option we actually require.

In future, we will move many options out of nova.config so many
of these import_opt() calls will either go away or cause a module
other than nova.config to be imported.

Change-Id: I0646efddecdf2530903afd50c1f4364cb1d5dce1

commit_message:
Remove nova.config.CONF

Modules import nova.config for two reasons right now - firstly, to
reference nova.config.CONF and, secondly, if they use one of the
options defined in nova.config.

Often modules import nova.openstack.common.cfg and nova.config
which is a bit pointless since they could just use cfg.CONF if
they just want to nova.config in order to reference CONF.

Let's just use cfg.CONF everywhere and we can explicitly state
where we actually require options defined in nova.config.

Change-Id: Ie4184a74e3e78c99658becb18dce1c2087e450bb

commit_message:
'BackupCreate' rotation parameter >= 0

In the extension 'admin-actions' of OpenStack Compute API, the action
create backups should only accept rotation parameter greater than or
equal to zero.

If the 'rotation' parameter is negative, OS API returns a badRequest
400 HTTP error.

Fixes LP bug #1071168

Change-Id: I6ef08fbecb0f88942cdb16193e9d2c3831866fe9

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-11-15 17:26:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Can you elaborate on what would be easier with this patch? It's not obvious from the patch itself.

I do have two concerns about this change that might make developers lives a little bit harder:
1) _instance_update() now has a different API than every other DB method, where it takes the object/dict and not the UUID. (For instance, ComputeVirtAPI.instance_update, etc) This inconsistency might end up causing some confusion.
2) While it takes an object/dict, it won't actually update it with the attributes that are being modified. It's required to use the return value to get the updated instance. This might also cause some confusion, especially since we've had a number of bugs caused by using stale data.

These aren't significant problems and I'm sure it will be a tradeoff with the subsequent patch in the end, I just don't know what the tradeoff is yet."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-11-15 17:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I think that the answer to the question lies somewhere in the fact that we're trying to remove as much of the "behaves like the db api" code from compute/manager as possible. These are all internal interfaces to compute/manager, and the changes are consistent (in style) with the no-db-messaging work that has been done already. To me, this extends that behavior from the manager's public API to its private one, which isn't a bad thing.

What if we change the _instance_update() function to something that relates it less closely to the db api function of a similar name, and make it sound more like what it's going to become? Something like "request_instance_changes()"?'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-15 19:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The source of inspiration for this patch was this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/16136/1/nova/compute/manager.py'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-16 01:28:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Pass around instance instead of just uuid.

While looking at a no-db-compute related patch, it became apparent that
it would be nice if the full instance was passed to _instance_update()
in the compute manager, as opposed to just the UUID.  This patch
implements that along with all other required changes to make it happen.

Related to blueprint no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I2594bed9c666ecb44652141fe57161c3a2c2955b

core number in capabilities:cpu_info:topology:cores.
    Multi-level capability check maybe helpful in some situation, like
user want to make sure host support SSE3 instructions or AES-NI, or
user want to make sure the host has >4 cores for SMP instance. Current
capability filter does not support these requirements.
    To support multi-level check, also add scope to capability filter,
so, now capability filter will handle no-scope extra_specs, or scope-format
as "capabilities:xxx:xxx" etc.

    Related to bp hw-feature-to-vm

commit_message:
Enhance compute capability filter to check multi-level

    Host state capabilities include multi-level information, like
cpu features are presented in capabilities:cpu_info:features, cpu
core number in capabilities:cpu_info:topology:cores.
    Multi-level capability check maybe helpful in some situation, like
user want to make sure host support SSE3 instructions or AES-NI, or
user want to make sure the host has >4 cores for SMP instance. Current
capability filter does not support these requirements.
    To support multi-level check, also add scope to capability filter,
so, now capability filter will handle no-scope extra_specs, or scope-format
as "capabilities:xxx:xxx" etc.

    Related to bp hw-feature-to-vm

Change-Id: Id714f99b4babbdb328b8e47f5a270be517b528d2
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Introduce a VFS api abstraction for manipulating disk images

Currently the file injection code has the assumumption that the
guest disk image can be mounted on the host filesystem, which
limits the techniques which can be used. Introducing a VFS API
abstraction allows the file injection code to be de-coupled
from the host filesystem.

blueprint: virt-disk-api-refactoring
Change-Id: I107c018586fd9b6fc2c7d497b7a437ac24f11944
Signed-off-by: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-19 21:52:04.000000000', 'message': "Pass rpc connection to pre_start_hook.

The pre_start_hook allows a manager to perform some additional service
setup before the service starts reading messages from message queues.
This patch moves the hook just a bit so that it's after creating the rpc
connection, but before creating the default queues, and most importantly
still before the service starts reading from the queues.

The pre_start_hook now gets the rpc_connection as an argument.  That
will allow this hook to set up some additional queues beyond the ones
that are set up by default in the base service code.

Change-Id: I5bf7795fca21627566ef4f688d45dc83bb953d1b
"}]
commit_message:
Pass rpc connection to pre_start_hook.

The pre_start_hook allows a manager to perform some additional service
setup before the service starts reading messages from message queues.
This patch moves the hook just a bit so that it's after creating the rpc
connection, but before creating the default queues, and most importantly
still before the service starts reading from the queues.

The pre_start_hook now gets the rpc_connection as an argument.  That
will allow this hook to set up some additional queues beyond the ones
that are set up by default in the base service code.

Change-Id: I5bf7795fca21627566ef4f688d45dc83bb953d1b

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-19 23:58:49.000000000', 'message': 'Adding tests to Reddwarf.

The tests come from the Reddwarf Integration repository. wsgi_intercept
is used to allow the test code to hit the server code directly. It also
properly sets up the SqlLite database before each run.

* Adds an "event simulator" which queues up functions that would
  normally be spawned with eventlet. The various sleep functions are
  then swapped with a method that runs these faux-events.

* Adds many of the Reddwarf Integration tests. The idea is these
  could still run in a richer, real environment, but are running here
  enables us to quickly check feature breaks for each commit and
  lowers the learning curve necessary to test the API. The downside
  is some of these tests still have artifacts of their origins, such
  as (unused) classes to connect to MySQL databases. Some more work
  will be necessary to separate the "real mode" functionality of these
  tests further.

Implements: blueprint tox-tests
Change-Id: I9857f265c1cb46832906ef5e6a0c7bb4a092e637

commit_message:
Adding tests to Reddwarf.

The tests come from the Reddwarf Integration repository. wsgi_intercept
is used to allow the test code to hit the server code directly. It also
properly sets up the SqlLite database before each run.

* Adds an "event simulator" which queues up functions that would
  normally be spawned with eventlet. The various sleep functions are
  then swapped with a method that runs these faux-events.

* Adds many of the Reddwarf Integration tests. The idea is these
  could still run in a richer, real environment, but are running here
  enables us to quickly check feature breaks for each commit and
  lowers the learning curve necessary to test the API. The downside
  is some of these tests still have artifacts of their origins, such
  as (unused) classes to connect to MySQL databases. Some more work
  will be necessary to separate the "real mode" functionality of these
  tests further.

Implements: blueprint tox-tests
Change-Id: I9857f265c1cb46832906ef5e6a0c7bb4a092e637

commit_message:
heat engine allow WatchRule load() from DB object

Allow WatchRule.load to initialize an object based on an existing
sqlalchemy DB object, similar to parser.Stack, avoids doing two
DB lookups when running the periodic watch tasks

Change-Id: I280942b81e5fdee17acf5582e3d319045afa7914
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-19 22:55:30.000000000', 'message': 'heat engine move to per-stack periodic watch threads

Use the stack thread groups, so a separate watch thread is started
for each stack - this avoids some of the context scoping problems
previously encountered since we can pass the correct context to the
periodic task when starting it

Fixes bug 1078779

Change-Id: I56e6a4b126199587e91548f450956d77ab2158f3
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat engine move to per-stack periodic watch threads

Use the stack thread groups, so a separate watch thread is started
for each stack - this avoids some of the context scoping problems
previously encountered since we can pass the correct context to the
periodic task when starting it

Fixes bug 1078779

Change-Id: I56e6a4b126199587e91548f450956d77ab2158f3
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

add watch_rule_get_all_by_stack dbapi call

Add option to retrieve all watch rules for a given stack, which
will be required to move to periodic watch threads per-stack

Ref bug 1078779

Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
WatchRule refer to stack by id not name

Rework WatchRule to refer to stacks by uuid not name, this will
help us move to allowing non-unique stack names containing WatchRule
resources

Ref bug 1078779

Change-Id: Idbbbd65a05d7036860cc2feb044d568210071d21
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-16 15:58:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes an error reporting bug on Hyper-V

Fixes Bug #1079739

In case of errors during Hyper-V job executions, error reporting is not working
properly due to a bug in the way in which the message is formatted.

This fix handles the formatting properly for any type of WMI job.

Change-Id: Ife2756d42d14e19d9e7f204c317adc248025041a
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes an error reporting bug on Hyper-V

Fixes Bug #1079739

In case of errors during Hyper-V job executions, error reporting is not working
properly due to a bug in the way in which the message is formatted.

This fix handles the formatting properly for any type of WMI job.

Change-Id: Ife2756d42d14e19d9e7f204c317adc248025041a

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-08 09:12:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-11-08 09:34:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

You could have a 100G image on a 20MB/s disk, and so still block nova for long periods of time, so this gets a +1 for being better but not a +2 because it doesn't actually solve anything I think.

The idea of calling out to sha1sum was better I think as
it allowed nova to run concurrently with all the hashing?

On a general note, I'm wondering if this additional 
checksumming is warranted at all given the overhead.
If its used for functional advantage for image id or
something then maybe, but if only used for verification
it seems like overkill?

Another general note is it would be cool if qcow could 
cache checksums internally that would be invalidated on write.
Even better would be if it cached checksums for portions
of the file so that only portions would need to be rehashed.
This could all (well apart from the invalidate on write bit)
be encapsulated in `qemu-img checksum` which would just
return the cached checksum or reshash the portions of the 
file as needed."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-14 03:07:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

While this change is relatively harmless, I think pbrady's point of pushing the hashing to another process is a better solution."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-11-14 05:31:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I assert that this doesn't do any harm and therefore should go in. I suspect I'm not going to win that fight though."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-11-15 07:34:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Out of process would be great, and possibly even allow simpler algos to be used (not always sha1/md5 would be useful in making the whole hashing go quicker).'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-11-19 21:58:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I agree that there are much better solutions than this one, like what draigbrady and russellb suggested. But it shouldn't hold this one off because it does seem to make the problem slightly better. So I'm +2 this. :)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-19 21:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

commit_message:
Yield in between hash runs for the image cache manager.

This should stop the cache manager from locking up nova-compute for
long periods of time.

Change-Id: Icc510a55282b479b3ba673ac68aee793da1714fb

Can we perhaps make it so the conductor api class is a configurable much like compute_api_class is, etc?   It would be really nice to have a conductor API class that does the DB updates locally instead of over RPC.  This is another way that would allow people to move to nova-conductor at their own leisure.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-16 20:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: No score

@Chris: I think we could accomplish that without replacing the API class.  We could have a config option that optionally uses either conductor_rpcapi, or calls directly into the manager, instead.

I'm not sure I even like the idea, though.  Why would we do it?  If performance is bad enough that it's needed, then we shouldn't be doing this at all.  If it's about deployment simplicity ... well ... I'd argue that giving people a choice adds complication.  It's more straight forward when we just say "this is *the* way it's deployed".'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-16 20:06:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(-1 while waiting on the FLAGS fix)"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-11-16 21:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-16 22:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Russell:  It wasn't about performance concerns, otherwise ya, I'd scream about why we were doing this at all. :)  It's simply about not causing a lot of immediate work for people that are running trunk.  (The work being everything needed to get nova-conductor up and running in their environment.)  And ya, a boolean over a class setting would work."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-17 01:23:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

You're missing super()s in the API classes..   It's not causing a bug because you never use self.db from base.Base.  But that means you don't have a need to subclass base.Base. :)   -1 for this, not necessarily the other comments inline."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-17 01:23:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(I should clarify... missing super()s from __init__()s in the API classes)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-11-17 01:28:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-11-17 01:32:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Thanks, Chris. I'll admit I'm a little burned out on this at this point. I just resubmitted with all the imports removed that I don't need from in there and the API classes unlinked from themselves and Base.base.

Hopefully this looks good and if not, I'll punt until Monday to limit further damage :D

commit_message:
Add the beginnings of the nova-conductor service

This adds a new service called "nova-conductor" which will provide
services for nova-compute, such as completing database updates and
handling long-running tasks.

Right now, this just adds a fraction of the database-related work
so that we can proceed with incremental changes to nova-compute.

For compatibility/flexibility, both LocalAPI and (RPC)API classes
are provided. Users concerned with performance or compatibility
who wish to maintain compute-node-local database accesses can
set the [conductor] use_local=True, which will mimic the legacy
behavior.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ib81d879f40b7daceeffad5af0631c7db68168661

'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2012-11-19 22:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hmm - I'm not sure about this:

This expects translations from an "openstack-common" domain, whereas elsewhere we also have files importing gettext directly, then using gettext.install to initialize translations in the "heat" domain.  

I'm not sure what the correct approach is here, but we should be consistent, and figure out how/where translations would be installed such that the domain we specify makes sense.

Also, it seems to me that gettextutils should probably use gettext.install instead of manually defining _(), which will break e.g if someone does the non-reccomended "from heat.openstack.common.gettextutils import *", since gettextutils doesn't define __all__

Finally, the import convention looks weird, if you move away from defining and explicitly importing _() from gettext utils (by using gettext.install) then all you have to do is "import heat.openstack.common.gettextutils", as gettextutils is simply a gettext import followed by a gettext.install (although I'm not sure wrapping it in openstack-common really makes sense due to the domain concerns mentioned above)'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2012-11-19 22:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2012-11-19 22:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Yip, I think you are right.'}]

commit_message:
Possible commandline scheme for moniker-client.

Each command needs to be enumerated in shell.py, and also enumerated
in setup.py.  Arguments for each command are automatically generated
from the associated object schema.

Change-Id: I28ed647783452075961c8c0147cbb2380b07dc80

subject: Do a stack lookup for all resource requests
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-19 21:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/16466/1/check/gate-heat-merge/1162 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16466/1/check/gate-heat-pep8/1162 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16466/1/check/gate-heat-python26/1162 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16466/1/check/gate-heat-python27/1162 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16466/1/check/dev-heat-coverage/275 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2012-11-19 21:53:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The issue with this is that doing a lookup for e.g. /stacks/stack_name/resources/resource_name/meaningless_garbage will return 302 Found, but upon actually GETting the URL /stacks/stack_name/<stack_id>/resources/resource_name/meaningless_garbage you'd get a 404 Not Found.

I would definitely consider adding something like this in the future and it would be nice to have, but it will require a much more sophisticated approach on the backend to work out whether the target path actually exists. It may turn out that the overhead required makes it not worth it."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2012-11-19 21:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Will handle this on the client side for now'}]

Change-Id: Iffd0af5e57f5b91acc15a22b48d1098ae3ae726b
'}]
commit_message:
Do a stack lookup for all resource requests

Adds a wildcard to {path:resources} mapping. Also works for metadata path.

Change-Id: Iffd0af5e57f5b91acc15a22b48d1098ae3ae726b

commit_message:
Import auth_token middleware from keystoneclient

Although the master auth_token file is now in keystoneclient, it will take
some time to get all the paste files to point to it there rather than here.
Hence, we import it back here to provide backward compatibility for a release
or so, after which we will remove it from the server.

Change-Id: Iccdb7839a611cdda233e4ea96f68c64d6d82f49c

commit_message:
Simplify human-readable size output

* Limit human-readable sizes to a single decimal
* Drop trailing zero
* Step one suffix further in the case of a size being 1024

Change-Id: I2eb8ac0571d3d08b52f62155912863870573a37c

commit_message:
Provide more information with template URL error

Previously a generic read error was given. Inform the user with proper
exceptions for: the case when a resource is present but non-responsive
and when a resource is present but the requested data could not be
found.

Fixes bug 1072951

Change-Id: I35b92cea38358691015f8752e80efc6720e34e48
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Disallow updating deleted images.

1. Return a 403 Forbidden error when an admin user tries to update a deleted
image.
2. Also added unit test coverage.

Fixes LP: #1060930

Change-Id: I8290c8c9f1bcbbfbff7d54f141bdcfa1c40aab6f

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-19 18:48:09.000000000', 'message': 'Make service.create load logic aware of groups

Right now, all of the %s_manager options have to be in the top-
level group in order for the Service.create() logic to find them.
This patch adds an additional step of looking for

  [%(name)s]
  manager = ...

to the load logic to allow sub-services to be grouped more nicely.

Change-Id: I9e9c8706f29106bdc0083172e4b4759aa3cc36dd
'}]
commit_message:
Make service.create load logic aware of groups

Right now, all of the %s_manager options have to be in the top-
level group in order for the Service.create() logic to find them.
This patch adds an additional step of looking for

  [%(name)s]
  manager = ...

to the load logic to allow sub-services to be grouped more nicely.

Change-Id: I9e9c8706f29106bdc0083172e4b4759aa3cc36dd

commit_message:
Audit error logging

Reduce log level from error to info/debug in several cases
where users do something silly. The operator of Glance
does not need to be alerted with an ERROR log in these
cases.

Fixes bug 1079211.

Change-Id: I09d86c8727530cf58f22446493ef9c4789d5d6cb

commit_message:
Make image sizes more readable for humans

By introducing the parameter --human-readable for several functions
(image-list, image-show, image-update, image-create) it's possible
to convert the size in bytes to something more readable like
9.309MB or 1.375GB.

Change-Id: I4e2654994361dcf330ed6d681dbed73388f159cb

commit_message:
Set useful boolean flag metavars

The boolean flags --is-protected and --is-public now
communicate that they must be set to True or False.

Fixes bug 1056501.

Change-Id: I23094ea556eb71d6eb977a64c171119738ed792b

commit_message:
Use the auth_token middleware from keystoneclient

The auth_token middleware moved into keystoneclient so a full
keystone install is not required to use the middleware.

Change-Id: I788300449e37ba1732f6482ebce5f480a2c14a41

Fix calls to private method in linux_net

LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver currently calls private method in linux_net.
Modify this private method into a public method

Fixes bug 883299

[{'created': '2012-11-19 16:55:52.000000000', 'message': "Drop unused PostgreSQL sequences from Folsom.

In Folsom the snapshots and volumes tables were converted to use
UUID's. When we performed this conversion in Folsom a couple of
unused PostgreSQL sequences were left behind.

This migration removes the snapshots_id_seq and volumes_id_seq
if they exist in the schema when using PostgreSQL.

Change-Id: I075e2afebcb5236f96ab5d6ab13e249d078da86b

UUID's. When we performed this conversion in Folsom a couple of

commit_message:
Drop unused PostgreSQL sequences from Folsom.

In Folsom the snapshots and volumes tables were converted to use
UUID's. When we performed this conversion in Folsom a couple of
unused PostgreSQL sequences were left behind.

This migration removes the snapshots_id_seq and volumes_id_seq
if they exist in the schema when using PostgreSQL.

Fixes LP Bug #1080786.

Change-Id: I075e2afebcb5236f96ab5d6ab13e249d078da86b

commit_message:
Simplify libvirt volume testing code.

There is no need to copy all of the iscsi generation from
provider_location because provider_location is an internal
implementation detail from cinder. We just need to make sure that
we handle values for iqn and target properly.

Change-Id: Ic80228ad22e58887a93d45168a6ad5f2f6c30e20

commit_message:
Compact pre-Grizzly database migrations.

Compacts the pre-Grizzly database migrations into a single
migration (133_folsom.py).

Pre-Grizzly users will need to upgrade to Folsom before
running any Grizzly migrations.

Tested on PostgreSQL and MySQL schemas on Fedora 17 to ensure the
new compacted migration generates an identical schema to the previous
migrate scripts in Folsom.

Change-Id: I1235215bfb6edc00c78240f895f927a079585559

commit_message:
Fix signing_dir option for auth_token middleware.

The keystone auth_token middleware expects an option named
'signing_dir'.  The sample api-paste.ini file for nova defined
'signing_dirname' instead.

Fix bug 1073858.

Change-Id: Ie9a3df73a8d9d52b48d6e0bcce0aae762af929a9
(cherry picked from commit a754825c6a91d1e7b2db6a2b49de1ca65370cb21)
