revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-14 23:12:21.000000000', 'message': 'create_db_entry_for_new_instance did not call sgh for default

When an instance is launched create_db_entry_for_new_instance() is
called which calls self.db.instance_create(). Then,
db.security_group_ensure_default() is called which creates the
default security group entry in the nova db. Though the sgh handler was
not called. Alternatively, if any nova secgroup-* call is made the sgh
is called which creates the default security group. This patch adds
a call to ensure_default() before db.instance_create() so the sgh
is called. Fixes a case missed in  bug 1050982

Change-Id: I9649b5ef026ca18a55abfb66e87fd0e358eba6f2
'}]
commit_message:
create_db_entry_for_new_instance did not call sgh for default

When an instance is launched create_db_entry_for_new_instance() is
called which calls self.db.instance_create(). Then,
db.security_group_ensure_default() is called which creates the
default security group entry in the nova db. Though the sgh handler was
not called. Alternatively, if any nova secgroup-* call is made the sgh
is called which creates the default security group. This patch adds
a call to ensure_default() before db.instance_create() so the sgh
is called. Fixes a case missed in  bug 1050982

Change-Id: I9649b5ef026ca18a55abfb66e87fd0e358eba6f2

[{'created': '2012-11-13 23:52:04.000000000', 'message': 'Ensures User is member of tenant in ec2 validation

It is possible that a user is no longer a member of a tenant when
they attempt to use an ec2 token. This checks to make sure that
the user still has at least one valid role in the tenant before
authenticating them. This should automatically work for the s3
version as well since it is a subclass.

Fixes bug 1064914

Change-Id: Ieb237bae936a7b00ce7ba4d4c59aec6c7a69ec21
'}]
commit_message:
Ensures User is member of tenant in ec2 validation

It is possible that a user is no longer a member of a tenant when
they attempt to use an ec2 token. This checks to make sure that
the user still has at least one valid role in the tenant before
authenticating them. This should automatically work for the s3
version as well since it is a subclass.

Fixes bug 1064914

Change-Id: Ieb237bae936a7b00ce7ba4d4c59aec6c7a69ec21

commit_message:
Fix network RPC API backwards compat

Commit d96102b6 bumped the RPC API version, but didn't handle backwards
compatibility correctly.

We need to retain support for the old 1.1 clients passing the original
set of kwargs - we can't rename kwargs, nor can we make new kwargs
required.

Change-Id: I083e0fa156e9d30fa51a500ed3d5a8ebb7c8eac8

Changes the links to go to /folsom/ rather than /trunk/
for run and install pages.

Should give more opportunity for doc comments.

Change-Id: Ib4cadae1510b8ee47c1f70ebdbd7a367bac051a3

Mark, sorry I did not see your comment. Ideally both patches should be synced. An alternative is for me to have a Quantum version that supported both configurations. If and when that is approved then we can get this through and then update accordingly.
It would be ideal if we can get the approval at the same time. 
Honestly I am not sure if there are any users who use Quantum and Linuxbridge plugin - the majority are using OVS.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-13 10:01:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-13 10:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Hi,
A number of things:
1. The code has been rebased
2. It has been assigned to a relevant bug (which is the first step to addressing the VIF issues)
It would be nice if this can get in as part of G-1. It is a critical issue for anyone using Quantum and linux bridge. Due to the fact that this is dependant on a code change in Quantum it is best that this get through on Nova first and then we push the Quantum change (it has been reviewed - latest change just updated bug id).
My two cents is that this is also a folsom backport which is essential.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-13 10:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/14830/12/check/gate-nova-merge/11946 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/14830/12/check/gate-nova-pylint/2832 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-11-13 13:14:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Hi Gary,

question: after this code is in Nova, but before the quantum patch is in, would LinuxBridge still work?'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-13 14:07:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

No, it will not.
I think that there are 2 options here:
1. Try and get both patches in as close to one another as possible.
2. In Nova I can add in a new VIF driver until Quantum is in. Then the code will be backward compatible until Quantum is in. Then I can remove it.
Please let me know which you think is best.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-13 15:16:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

I am going to make a change to Quantum that will support nova before and after. This will be ready soon. This will enable us to get Quantum in first and then update Nova....
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-11-13 15:34:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Gary, that'd be the best option to me. Thanks a lot for the effort."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-13 19:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Hi,
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14961/ will work with the current patch and the existing code. As soon as that is in we are good to go.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-15 20:14:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Hi,
The Quantum patch has been successfully pushed. This means that nothing will be broken and this patch is ready for review.

Enable Quantum linux bridge VIF driver to use "bridge" type

Fixes bug 1078210

This fix should be used in conjunction with the patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14961/

Fix the parameter expansion issue in configure_tempest.sh

We need follow the syntax like ${parameter:-word} for OS_PASSWORD set.

[{'created': '2012-11-13 02:46:24.000000000', 'message': 'Remove outdated Debian packaging guide.

There are 3 sections in there, all useless.

Section 1 tells you how to install Swift packages from the swift-core
PPA. However, the latest version there is ancient.

Section 2 tells you how to build your own Swift packages. However, it
talks about getting the source code from the "debian" branch in bzr,
which is obviously really old.

Section 3 tells you how to take the packages from section 2 and
install them. This isn't too out-of-date, but since section 2 doesn't
work any more, section 3 is useless.

Since stale docs are worse than no docs, there's no current
information in this document, and bringing it up-to-date requires a
whole pile of work, I've chosen to delete it entirely.

Fixes bug 917385.
Fixes bug 1026145.

Change-Id: I510bd8619531fe110419e5488bd20d3602868d66

commit_message:
Remove outdated Debian packaging guide.

There are 3 sections in there, all useless.

Section 1 tells you how to install Swift packages from the swift-core
PPA. However, the latest version there is ancient.

Section 2 tells you how to build your own Swift packages. However, it
talks about getting the source code from the "debian" branch in bzr,
which is obviously really old.

Section 3 tells you how to take the packages from section 2 and
install them. This isn't too out-of-date, but since section 2 doesn't
work any more, section 3 is useless.

Since stale docs are worse than no docs, there's no current
information in this document, and bringing it up-to-date requires a
whole pile of work, I've chosen to delete it entirely.

Also pulled out a couple references to the PPA elsewhere.

Fixes bug 917385.
Fixes bug 1026145.

Change-Id: I510bd8619531fe110419e5488bd20d3602868d66

commit_message:
Allow group='foo' in self.flags() for tests.

Cells config options are in a 'cells' config group, and this is needed
to support the tests.

Fixes bug 1079378

Change-Id: I6b6f2f9f5430b8bab8194a2766fe8075e45d92b1

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-13 00:41:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the log test so it uses the available context fields.

logging_context_format_string in log.py references fields
that don't exist in the common/context.py so we get errors
like:

---
File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 467, in format
    s = self._fmt % record.__dict__
KeyError: 'project_id'
Logged from file test_log.py, line 42
---

We could change the defaults in log.py but that might cause
too much disruption to other projects.

Change-Id: Ic3f6039baccb522b5eb2462a87b792c226ca13ef
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the log test so it uses the available context fields.

logging_context_format_string in log.py references fields
that don't exist in the common/context.py so we get errors
like:

---
File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/logging/__init__.py", line 467, in format
    s = self._fmt % record.__dict__
KeyError: 'project_id'
Logged from file test_log.py, line 42
---

We could change the defaults in log.py but that might cause
too much disruption to other projects.

Change-Id: Ic3f6039baccb522b5eb2462a87b792c226ca13ef

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-15 14:14:38.000000000', 'message': 'Enhance log msg to report referer and user-agent

Enhance internally logged messages to report referer and user-agent.

Pass the referering URL between internal servers, and set the
user-agent to be the server type (obj-server, container-server) with
the process PID. In conjunction with the transaction ID, it helps to
track down which PID form a given system was responsible for
initiating the request and what that server was working on to make
this request.

This has been helpful in tracking down interactions between object,
container and account servers one the proxy server has forwarded the
request.

Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I3aa8ab2f4413d2a78775ba3f2077a1509ec66ac2
'}]
commit_message:
Enhance log msg to report referer and user-agent

Enhance internally logged messages to report referer and user-agent.

Pass the referering URL between internal servers, and set the
user-agent to be the server type (obj-server, container-server) with
the process PID. In conjunction with the transaction ID, it helps to
track down which PID form a given system was responsible for
initiating the request and what that server was working on to make
this request.

This has been helpful in tracking down interactions between object,
container and account servers one the proxy server has forwarded the
request.

Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I3aa8ab2f4413d2a78775ba3f2077a1509ec66ac2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-15 18:31:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes bug on Windows related to a wrong API url

Fixes Bug #1079323

python-glanceclient (latest repository code) fails on Windows due to a
malformed API url. This error is due to the usage of os.path.normpath(),
which should not be used for URLs as it swaps "/" with "\" on Windows.

The fix consists in using posixpath.normpath().
Please see also https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1077125 and related
commit.

Change-Id: Iaa643bd579963ad9ffbf10674973cbca75d435ac
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes bug on Windows related to a wrong API url

Fixes Bug #1079323

python-glanceclient (latest repository code) fails on Windows due to a
malformed API url. This error is due to the usage of os.path.normpath(),
which should not be used for URLs as it swaps "/" with "\" on Windows.

The fix consists in using posixpath.normpath().
Please see also https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1077125 and related
commit.

Change-Id: Iaa643bd579963ad9ffbf10674973cbca75d435ac

commit_message:
Restore keystone --token/--endpoint (bug 1077672)

Commit 2ca3a6 [1] included some changes that were specific to grizzly a bit
too soon. This change reverts --os-token to --token and --os-endpoint to
--endpoint as seen in keystoneclient during the folsom timeframe.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/2ca3a64c0cf009b649a8

Change-Id: Ide33fb1d4acba46a8d444ab9d4d3d604dc916763

commit_message:
Completely remove cfg's disable_interspersed_args()

The use case for disable_interspersed_args() is that nova-manage
needs to be able to parse sub-commands. We now have a
add_cli_subparsers() method which better supports this use case.

Change-Id: I1fcd15889745fe4ddff0ac4bacf385004f9b61af

commit_message:
Add an image domain model and related helpers.

This patch is the first in a series refactoring the logic around image
manipulation. In this patch, we add a domain module that has Images and
ways of constructing them. In anticipation of proxy classes added in
subsequent patches, we also define some base classes to make proxying
simpler.

Partially implements bp:glance-domain-logic-layer

Change-Id: Ie72f2f86cfcbd15e41c32deed3626290f2bf0e6b

'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-11-14 15:24:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-11-15 01:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

is get_memory_mb_used currently used during scheduling?  I thought we moved away from this at one point.'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2012-11-15 02:25:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The call isn't made directly during scheduling. However, the schedule uses data generated by the resource tracker periodic job (i.e. result of this call which is placed in the DB)."}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-11-15 02:50:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Rafi -

It doesn't matter what value of memory_mb_used gets reported to scheduler.  The resource tracker is going to ignore it and calculated the usage based off of the total amount of memory allocated to VMs on that host.

So, I would say you might as well leave the driver to report a value that give some information about the current hypervisor usage level.

You can merge this change if you want and it won't harm anything, but it won't actually change anything from the scheduler's point of view."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2012-11-15 18:56:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

I agree with Brian -- if the scheduler isn't using this value then I'd rather have the DB report actual memory usage on the hypervisor."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-14 00:52:34.000000000', 'message': 'Report memory usage based on VM allocation

Fixes bug 1078348

Previously reporting of the memory used by a hypervisor was
calculated based on what the system reported. This provided
an inaccurate view of reality since VMs will only actually
consume the memory once a request has been made for allocation.

The libvirt driver has been updated to report memory usage
based on what all active VMs have reserved. This eliminates
the possibility oversubscribing memory and thereby running
the system out of resources.

Change-Id: I43f5e450e49e626c58c5a56e639aa238ab6fc465
'}]
commit_message:
Report memory usage based on VM allocation

Fixes bug 1078348

Previously reporting of the memory used by a hypervisor was
calculated based on what the system reported. This provided
an inaccurate view of reality since VMs will only actually
consume the memory once a request has been made for allocation.

The libvirt driver has been updated to report memory usage
based on what all active VMs have reserved. This eliminates
the possibility oversubscribing memory and thereby running
the system out of resources.

Change-Id: I43f5e450e49e626c58c5a56e639aa238ab6fc465

commit_message:
Clarify server_name, hostname, host.

Specifically:

'hostname' refers to the instance.
'host' refers to the nova node.
'server_name' refers to nothing and I've removed it.

Change-Id: I29e2486dddc71289018fca58a4f02f1f3b0d1b9e
